cardInfo.description: Theming system with CSS variables and design tokens

attributes.instructions: ### Boxel Theming #### Having a Theme - Here is what it means for a card to have a theme: Card instance will link to a ThemeCard from its `cardInfo.theme`. #### ThemeCard - A ThemeCard is a card instance of a card definition that inherit from `https://cardstack.com/base/theme/default` or from one of its subclasses. Here are some of its known subclasses: - `https://cardstack.com/base/structured-theme/default` - `https://cardstack.com/base/style-reference/default` - `https://cardstack.com/base/brand-guide/default` #### Default Theme - All newly created cards that do not have a theme — EXCEPT ThemeCards (those that adopt from `https://cardstack.com/base/theme/default` or its subclasses) — MUST link to `"https://realms-staging.stack.cards/catalog/Theme/cardstack.json"`. Here is what it looks like in card JSON: ```json "relationships": { "cardInfo.theme": { "links": { "self": "https://realms-staging.stack.cards/catalog/Theme/cardstack.json" } } } ``` - IMPORTANT: Do not ever link to a theme from a ThemeCard's `cardInfo.theme`. This is likely to cause an infinite cycle error. #### How to Create a Card Instance That Is Compatible With Theming - In card template CSS, you must use Shadcn css variables. ##### Color Use the below css variables instead of hardcoding color values. ``` --background --foreground --card --card-foreground --popover --popover-foreground --primary --primary-foreground --secondary --secondary-foreground --muted --muted-foreground --accent --accent-foreground --destructive --destructive-foreground --border --input --ring --chart-1 --chart-2 --chart-3 --chart-4 --chart-5 --sidebar --sidebar-foreground --sidebar-primary --sidebar-primary-foreground --sidebar-accent --sidebar-accent-foreground --sidebar-border --sidebar-ring ``` Incorrect: ❌ `background-color: hsl(var(--background));` ❌ `background: hsl(var(--card));` Correct: ✅ `background-color: var(--background);` ✅ `background: var(--card);` - Important: Ensure that there's sufficient contrast between a background color and a foreground color. Some of the color variables mentioned are meant to go together. For example: ```css background-color: var(--card); color: var(--card-foreground); ``` ##### Font-Family Use the below variables for setting font-families: ``` --font-sans --font-serif --font-mono ``` Example usage in a css class: `font-family: var(--font-serif);` Note: `--font-sans` will apply to a card by default. Use `--font-serif` when serif font-family is needed. Use `--font-mono` when monospace font-family is needed. ##### Border-Radius Use `--radius` as the css variable for setting border-radius. You also can use the following boxel variables that recalculate based on the value of `--radius`: ``` --boxel-border-radius-xxs --boxel-border-radius-xs --boxel-border-radius-sm --boxel-border-radius --boxel-border-radius-lg --boxel-border-radius-xl --boxel-border-radius-xxl ``` Example usage: ```css border-radius: var(--radius); ``` ##### Spacing (Margin, Padding) Use `--spacing` as the css variable for setting the base spacing unit. It defaults to `0.25rem`. You can also use the following boxel variables that recalculate based on the value of `--spacing`: ``` --boxel-sp-6xs --boxel-sp-5xs --boxel-sp-4xs --boxel-sp-xxxs --boxel-sp-xxs --boxel-sp-xs --boxel-sp-sm --boxel-sp --boxel-sp-lg --boxel-sp-xl --boxel-sp-xxl --boxel-sp-xxxl ``` Example usage: ```css padding: var(--spacing); margin-top: calc(var(--spacing) * 2); ``` ##### Letter-spacing Use `--tracking-normal` for letter-spacing. You can also use the following variables: ``` --boxel-lsp-xxl --boxel-lsp-xl --boxel-lsp-lg --boxel-lsp --boxel-lsp-sm --boxel-lsp-xs --boxel-lsp-xxs ``` ##### Box-shadow Use the below variables for the box-shadow shorthand property: ``` --shadow-2xs --shadow-xs --shadow-sm --shadow --shadow-md --shadow-lg --shadow-xl --shadow-2xl ``` You can also use the boxel box-shadow variables below: ``` --boxel-box-shadow --boxel-box-shadow-hover --boxel-deep-box-shadow ``` Example usage: ```css box-shadow: var(--shadow-lg); ``` The below variables refer to individual box-shadow property values (not shorthand): ``` --shadow-x --shadow-y --shadow-blur --shadow-spread --shadow-opacity --shadow-color ``` ### CSS Safety (All Formats) - Always use ` ```
